Turis Ditemukan Dehidrasi Usai 3 Hari Hanyut di Laut
05 Nov 2019, 08:45 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Foto: Folegrandos island (iStock)

Folegrandos - Sempat menghilang tiga hari, seorang turis wanita asal New Zealand yang sedang berlibur di Pulau Yunani akhirnya ditemukan. Dia hanyut sejauh lebih dari 180 km dari tempatnya hilang.Dikumpulkan dari berbagai sumber, turis wanita berusia 45 tahun itu tengah berlibur dengan kapal sewaan bersama suaminya. Dia pergi ke daratan menggunakan perahu karet untuk membeli sejumlah peralatan. Saat ingin kembali, perahunya tertiup angin sehingga dia tidak berhasil menuju kapal asalnya.Saat terombang-ambing di laut, wanita bernama Kushila Stein ini membungkus dirinya dengan plastik agar tetap hangat. Dia mengatasi rasa lapar dengan mengemil segenggam manisan rebus tanpa minum selama dua malam.Stein terhanyut saat melintas di Laut Aegean. Enam kapal dan helikopter angkatan laut pun sudah berusaha mencarinya. Pada akhirnya, seorang penjaga pantai yang berpatroli menemukan wanita ini di wilayah 80 km sebelah utara Kreta.

[Gambas:Twitter]

Kepala penjaga pantai di Folegrandos, Vassiliki Katsadoni, menceritakan kejadian sebelum wanita ini menghilang di Pulau Folengandros, Yunani. Stein sempat ke daratan untuk pergi ke sebuah toko."Mereka berlabuh di Teluk Agkali dan dia dengan cepat naik perahu untuk pergi ke pantai dan membeli beberapa persediaan," kata Katsadoni."Dia menelpon suaminya untuk memberi tahu bahwa dia mencoba untuk kembali ke kapal tapi tidak berhasil," imbuhnya.Wanita itu kini dibawa ke Herakleion di Kreta dan dirawat karena dehidrasi. Seorang juru bicara mengatakan, "Kami menemukannya hidup, tapi dia benar-benar kelelahan."Simak Video "Kapal Penyelam AS Terbakar, 25 orang Tewas dan 9 Hilang"[Gambas:Video 20detik](elk/krs)

Tourists Found Dehydration After 3 Days Drifting in the Sea
05 Nov 2019, 08:45 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Photo: Folegrandos island (iStock)

Folegrandos - Had disappeared for three days, a female tourist from New Zealand who was vacationing on the Greek Island was finally found. She was washed away more than 180 km from her lost place. Collected from various sources, the 45-year-old woman tourist was on vacation with a chartered boat with her husband. He went ashore to use a rubber boat to buy some equipment. When he wanted to return, his boat was blown off so that he could not make it to his native ship. While adrift in the sea, this woman named Kushila Stein wrapped herself in plastic to keep her warm. He overcame hunger by snacking on a handful of boiled sweets without drinking for two nights. Stein was swept away while crossing the Aegean Sea. Six ships and navy helicopters were already trying to find it. In the end, a coast guard on patrol found this woman in an area 80 km north of Crete.

[Gambas: Twitter]

The head of the coast guard on Folegrandos, Vassiliki Katsadoni, recounts the incident before this woman disappeared on the island of Folengandros, Greece. Stein had landed to go to a shop. "They were anchored in Agkali Bay and he quickly took a boat to go to the beach and bought some supplies," Katsadoni said. it didn't work, "he added. The woman is now being taken to Herakleion on Crete and being treated for dehydration. A spokesman said, "We found him alive, but he was really exhausted."
